page.title: 03ECOLOGY (cont)
page.content: The snow stays a little longer in Hennock because of the height and because it is exposed to the north easterly winds.The ice stays on hills and makes it hard to travel. Because of the close proximity of Dartmoor the rainfall is quite high. The River Bovey runs through our area and eventually having joined The Teign,meets the sea at Teignmouth. In the past the River Bovey has flooded and caused problems in the Dolphin Square area of Bovey Tracey.This year has seen a new flood alleviation scheme put into operation. The soil around about Bovey Tracey is mainly Ball Clay,hence the abundance of potteries in the surrounding areas.
